definitions.definition: the state or quality of being hard to do or to understand; the effort that something involves
definitions.sensetop: difficulty (in) doing somethingwith difficultywithout difficultydifficulty of doing something

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the senses ‘requiring effort or skill’ and ‘something difficult’): from Latin difficultas, from dis- (expressing reversal) + facultas ‘ability, opportunity’.
